Sequence Information.Peptide Name: WBp-1 (Wheat bran peptide 1, natural AMPs, plants, UCLL1)

Literature.Author: Zou Z, Purnawan MA, Wang Y, Ismail BB, Zhang X, Yang Z, Guo M. 2024
Literature.Title: A novel antimicrobial peptide WBp-1 from wheat bran: Purification, characterization and antibacterial potential against Listeria monocytogenes.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (45.45%) toPonericin W6I: 28%; A=G: 17%; S=K: 11%. GRAVY: 0.9; mol Wt: 1784.127; mol formula: C82H138N22O22; mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: active against L. monocytogenes (MIC 84 uM), E.coli ATCC 8739 (MIC 168 uM), S.typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 280 uM), and S.aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 112 uM). killed L. monocytogenes in 6 min at 4x MIC.  Peptidoglycan (PGN) can inhibit peptide activity.Structure:  random coils in water and helical in 50% TFE or 30 mM SDS.In vitro toxicity: murine RBC: 5% hemolysis at 16 fold MIC. poorly hemo.lytic. At 16 fold MIC, 80% human hepatocyte LO2 cells survived.
